intro: Dunalia cornifolia, commonly known as the horned leaf dunalia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves that resemble horns, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Dunalia cornifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
